sourceMeaningMnemonic: You have a <radical>samurai</radical> with a <radical>flag</radical> on a <radical>stick</radical>. On his flag is this symbol, the kanji for <kanji>voice</kanji>. Why does he have that there? He feels like his Shogun isn't giving him and his fellow Samurai a voice, so he's brought a flag with the word "voice" written on it to protest.
meaningInfo: Imagine him and other samurai with their flags on sticks waving them around shouting things like "we want a voice in politics!" etc., etc.
readingMnemonic: Once you start asking the samurai more specific questions about how he wants more <kanji>voice</kanji> he starts playing <reading>coy</reading> (<ja>こえ</ja>) with you. He doesn't really know what he wants, he's just here for the sake of protesting.
readingInfo: Then you ask him out on a date. He still plays coy with you... one of those samurai, I guess.
